intro: Chazaliella viridicalyx, commonly known as the green-veined chazaliella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive greenish hue on the underside. Chazaliella viridicalyx is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
